channel.title: PI - Object Placing/Moving
channel.description:
Hello, I'm having trouble trying to find the file for placing/moving objects at set coordinates. and If I find the file, what do I look for? Can Anyone Help?
Thanks, KR3W

item.title: PI - Object Placing/Moving
item.dc:creator: @K_R_3_W K R 3 W
item.description:
@K_R_3_W wrote:

Yes!
It was in the ObjectManager.java

Thank You All for the help.
KR3W

item.title: PI - Object Placing/Moving
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“K R 3 W, post:3, topic:443198”]I know all that…I have the Object ID, I know The Coordinates that the object is at right now, and where I want to put the object.
I just need to know the file name in which I place/move objects.
and what I have to look for once I find the file.

Anyone know?
Thanks,
KR3W[/quote]
I just told you how.
If you follow what I said. The file holding the coordinates will pop up in the search.
The you open that file and search for the coords again. Boom that’s the area you place it

Read full topic

item.title: PI - Object Placing/Moving
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“K R 3 W, post:1, topic:443198”]Hello, I’m having trouble trying to find the file for placing/moving objects at set coordinates.
and If I find the file, what do I look for?
Can Anyone Help?

Thanks,
KR3W[/quote]

Stand on an object.
get the coords using ::mypos or what ever you use.
Look up the coords in your server files.

Read full topic
